title: Pehlu Khan (55) and others
victim_action: were legally transporting two milch cows to Haryana in a pickup truck.
victim_names: Pehlu Khan (55), Azmat (22), Irshad, Aarif and Rafiq
accused_action: saw the victims's pick-up truck on the highway and assumed that they were transporting the bovines illegally.
the_lynching: The Gau Rakshaks intercepted the pick-up and proceeded to beat up the men. Pehlu Khan succumbs to injuries.

title: Mohammad Majloom (35) and others
sub_crime: Primarily theft. But also against cow slaughter.
victim_action: were legally walking with the cattle at night.
accused_names: Mithilesh Prasad Sahu, Pramod Kumar Sahu, Manoj Kumar Sahu, Manoj Sahu
accused_action: wanted to steal the victim's cows.
the_lynching: The villagers beat up the victims with sticks, strangled them and hanged their bodies on trees and finally hid their cows in the forest.

title: Mohammad Akhlaq (52) and others
victim_action: had goat meat at home.
accused_action: heard a rumour that a cow had been slaughtered and beef was stored in Akhlaq's house.
the_lynching: A mob of 200 stormed the house and beat up Akhlaq and son. Akhlaq died.

title: Anaf and and others
victim_action: allegedly stole two buffalos
accused_action: discovered the theft at 4am and started following the theives. At 6am they intercepted the theives.
the_lynching: The suspected thieves opened fire. While two of the five suspected thieves fled, three were allegedly beaten to death by the angry mob.

title: Zahid Ahmed Bhat (19) and others
victim_action: were driving a truck loaded with coal to Srinagar
victim_names: Zahid Ahmed Bhat (19) and Showkat Ahmed (35)
accused_action: had stopped traffic in view of the strike following recovery of three carcasses in the district.
the_lynching: A mob of 9 people threw a petrol bomb on Zahid's coal-laden truck. Zahid suffered 60% burn injuries and later succembed.

title: Noman (20) and others
victim_action: were rashly driving a truck with cattle. The truck failed to negotiate a sharp turn and crashed.
accused_action: suspected that the cattle were being taken to Uttar Pradesh for slaughter.
the_lynching: The villagers secured the cattle, caught the people travelling in the truck and beat them up. The villagers handed four of them to the police. Police found a critically-injured Noman by the mountainside the next day. He was taken to a local hospital, where he succumbed to his injuries.
which_law: Allegations of cattle smuggling. While Noman died, the other four were booked under Section 11 of the Prevention of Cruelty to Animals Act, Section 8 of the Himachal Pradesh Cow Slaughter Act and Section 429 of the IPC

title: Nazakat Ali (45) and others
victim_action: were legally moving with their cattle on foot from the plains to highland pastures.
victim_names: Nazakat Ali (45), Naseema (40), Sabar Ali (60), Abida Bibi (22) and Saina (8)
accused_tag: Vishwa Hindu Parishad and Bajrang Dal activists

title: Mohammed Hussain (43) and others
victim_action: traveling in the general compartment of the Kushinagar Express.
accused_action: acted on a tip-off about beef being transported by some passengers. They started searching the luggage of all passengers in the compartment.
the_lynching: This led to a scuffle. A black bag was found with suspected beef, which later turned out to be buffalo meat after laboratory tests. The owners of that bag were not found.
which_law:
The victims had not committed any crime. However, a black bag was found during the episode with buffalo meat. The police registered a case under Section 429 (mischief by killing or maiming 
cattle.) of the IPC against two unknown persons to whom the bag  belonged.

title: Unknown
victim_action: were illegally carrying 30 kgs meat at Mandsaur railway station.
accused_action: suspected that they were carrying beef.
the_lynching: The gau rakshaks beat up the women. The meat later turned out to be buffalo meat. Both the women have been taken into custody for ‘smuggling and trying to sell’ the meat.
which_law: buffalo meat is illegal in Madhya Pradesh without permission.

title: Mota Samadhiyala (46) and others
victim_action: were skinning a dead cow.
victim_names: Balu Sarvaiya (46), Vashram (26), Kunvarben, Ramesh (23), Bechar Sarvaiya (30), Ashok Sarvaiya (20) and Deveshi Babariya (32).
accused_names: Pramodigiri Goswami, Balvant Balvant Dhiru, Rasik, Ramesh Jadav, Rakesh Joshi and Nagji Ahir
accused_action: suspected that they had slaughtered the cow.
the_lynching: Gau rakshaks started abusing the victims and attacked them with iron pipes, sticks and a knife with which the victims were removing the skin of the carcass. After beating them up, the attackers reportedly took Vashram, Ramesh, Ashok and Bechar to Una town. There, they paraded the four victims, and flogged them publicly all the way to the police station.

title: Rizwan and others
victim_action: were illegally transporting 300 kg of beef.
accused_action: got a tip-off. They chased the victim's car for 7 kms before they finally managed to stop them.
the_lynching: They forced the victims to eat a concoction of cow dung, cow urine, milk, curd and ghee. The gau rakshaks later turned over the two men to Faridabad police.
which_law: cow meat is illegal in Haryana.

title: Unknown
victim_action: illegally slaughtered a buffalo.
victim_names: Kalu Baghel, Sonbeer, Vinod, Bunty, Chhotey and Imran
accused_action: spotted the blood at the dairy.
the_lynching: They broke into the diary and beat up the men.
which_law: cow meat is illegal in Haryana.

title: Mustain Abbas (27)
victim_action: were legally transporting two buffalos that they had bought.
accused_action: had blocked the road with tractors and were checking vehicles for cows.
the_lynching: The victims tried to turn their pick-up truck around but thorns on the road punctured their tyre. The gau rakshaks started firing. The 5 victims jumped out of the car and ran. The gau rakshaks caught Mustain, beat, stabbed and strangled him to death. Mustain's body was found a month later in a drain.

title: Dhanush (23) and others
victim_action: illegally slaughtered an ox.
accused_action: received a tip off and raiding their house and beat up the men before notifying the police.
which_law: one can legally slaughter a cow only with a fitness certificate — if they are old or diseased.

title: Mokati Elisha and others
victim_action: were skinning a dead cow.
accused_action: suspected that they had slaughtered the cow so they beat them up.
the_lynching: The cow had died of electrocution.

title: Apuda Malviya
victim_action: was beaten using belts and slippers.
accused_names: Chetan Sankhla, Vikas alias Bhura, Nilesh Sankhla and Shubham
accused_action: suspected that the victim had injured a cow.

title: Abu Hanifa (23) and others
victim_action: stole two cows from the grazing field.
the_lynching: The police on Monday did not term the incident as a case of ‘cow vigilantism’.

title: Narendra Kushwah (35) and others
victim_action: raped a girl and then tried to threaten the girl's family to withdraw the complaint against him.

title: Rajiv Sahni (25)
victim_action: trying to escape following a failed attempt of vehicle theft
the_lynching: Sahni and Kevat were overpowered by the villagers and beaten. Sahni died.

title: Sandeep Kumar
victim_action: was chasing smugglers during a routine patrol in the area near the Indo-Bangla border
accused_action: attacked the security men with lathis.
the_lynching: Villagers lynched one of them. The other opened fire in self-defence and killed one villager Ismail Mia and injured nine other.

title: Shazir (45)
victim_action: allegedly slaughtered a cow. Police booked him for cow slaughter
accused_action: attacked the house he was staying in
the_lynching: Shazir was beaten up severely and died on way to a hospital.

title: Unknown
victim_action: allegedly shot dead a lawyer
the_lynching: Mob lynched the 4 men

title: Mohsin Sadiq Shaikh (24)
victim_action: returning home with friend
accused_action: identified him as a muslim because of his beard and skull cap and beat him to death.
the_lynching: Communal tension across the city after derogatory pictures of Shivaji and Bal Thackeray uploaded on Facebook.

title: Unknown
victim_action: suspected of mobile thefts
accused_action: called them under a false pretext of enquiring about a theft and were taken to isolated spot
the_lynching: The two youth were tied up, beaten, paraded naked and dragged on the road by a mob of more than 30 people.

title: S K Maheshwari (69)
victim_action: was negotiating with workers union that the number of working days in a week be cut from five to three because of losses
the_lynching: The workers beat the CEO to death and at least two members of the management were injured.

title: Sohan Pal (24)
victim_action: Asked for the auto fare
the_lynching: Pal was hit on the head by a blunt object, most likely a stone. The injury resulted in internal bleeding, causing his death.

title: Unknown
victim_action: escaped with Rs 6.2 lakh cash and a Bolero vehicle
accused_action: gathered and blocked the road by placing tractors and other vehicles
the_lynching: The robbers left their vehicle after they spotted the villagers and took shelter in cane fields. The villagers surrounded the fields, overpowered and lynched two of them while others managed to escape.

title: Chhotu and others
victim_action: talking to each other near a parked tractor
the_lynching: The boys were caught by villagers and beaten unconscious.

title: Unknown
victim_action: shot dead a provisions store owner
the_lynching: Villagers lynched him to death.

title: Ali Ansari (28)
victim_action: refused to ferry them to their destination

victim_action: accused of stealing a buffalo
accused_tag: Police constable, home guard, property dealer
accused_names: Parminder Singh, Deepak Kumar, Bhupinder Singh Soma
accused_action: instead of lodging an FIR against him, the police took him to a farmhouse where he was beaten to death.

title: Korban Shah (30)
victim_action: suspected as a cell phone thief
the_lynching: His body was found tied around a pillar on the third floor of the hostel.

title: Jeetu (22)
victim_action: allegedly exposed himself "indecently" when a girl from his neighbourhood was passing by

title: Syed Sharif Khan (35)
victim_action: accused of raping a college student
accused_tag: hundreds of girls in school, college uniforms led lynch mob
accused_action: broke into the Dimapur Central Jail
the_lynching: They dragged out Khan, tied him by the waist and dragged for seven kilometres — being kicked and pelted with stones along the way until he died.

title: Unknown
victim_action: allegedly came to buy ganja (150 kilos)
the_lynching: beaten to death by villagers.

title: Unknown
victim_action: caught entering the godown around 4 am
accused_names: Rehmat Ali Khan, Habib Sheikh and Rajkumar Yadav
accused_action: The accused tied him up and assaulted him, following which the man died.
the_lynching: There had been recently a theft in the area in which cellphones had been stolen.

title: Ikram Khan
victim_action: Confronted the accused for misbehaved with his mother

title: Deepak Kumar Yadav (23)
victim_action: Refused to give Rs 10 to the accused for buying gutkha
accused_names: Vinod Yadav, Rajesh Yadav, Tuntun Yadav and Tuntan Roy

victim_action: Maoists were holding a ‘praja court’
the_lynching: tribals attacked and lynched Sharat and two others

title: Shankar Kadam (40)
accused_action: went to the leader’s home allegedly demanding better work to be done in the area and ended up beating him up.

title: Debajani Bora
accused_action: dragged Bora to a community prayer hall, tied and beat her up.
the_lynching:
was tortured by villagers after a local priest “identified” her as a witch who had allegedly spread diseases and misfortune among the local people.
While a group of men tied Bora with a fishing net, video clippings taken by some persons on the mobile phone showed the priest, one Biswa Medhi, sitting on the woman and beating her up.

title: Mala Bhumij and others
victim_names: Mala Bhumij, Ratani Kond and Gangi Orang
the_lynching: were beaten up and physically tortured by several men and women until police reached the spot and rescued them. main culprit, a local “bez” (faith-healer) called Santosh. “A local bez on failing to cure a sick 14-year old boy put the blame on witchcraft and pointed at three women living close by following which the neighbours turned violent and severely beat up the three women.

title: Sk Dilwar (25)
victim_action: went to extort money
the_lynching: Locals lynched Dilwar (25) when tried to extort money from them at Dubrajpur.

title: Unknown
victim_action: Tried dispersing crowds
the_lynching: policemen suffered injuries in stone-throwing by a mob that had gathered on hearing rumours that cows were being taken for slaughter in three vehicles.

title: Nasirul Haque (30) and others
victim_action: Allegedly stole cattle
victim_names: Nasirul Haque (30), Mohammed Samiruddin (32), Mohammed Nasir
accused_names: Asit Basu (29), Asim Basu (27), and Krishna Poddar (24)
the_lynching: The mob blamed the trio for cattle theft, went after them iron rods, wooden sticks and stones

title: Riaz (42)
victim_action: allegedly stole a calf
accused_tag: Bajrang Dal and Vishwa Hindu Parishad members
the_lynching: Beating up a Muslim man for allegedly stealing a calf from a cowshed

title: Gulla Soma Banjaran (35) and others
victim_action: illegal transport of cattle
accused_action: he chased the duo and attacked them with an axe.
the_lynching: The man killed his two friends because they were involved in transporting cows for slaughter and refused to mend their ways despite being warned.

title: Harish and others
victim_action: illegally slaughtered cow
accused_names: Sunil Poojari, Chandrakanth Poojari, Gururaja Acharya and 10 others
accused_action: the gang led by Sunil Poojari entered the house around late night and assaulted the victims
the_lynching: The Karnataka police have booked 13 gau rakshaks for allegedly thrashing three Koraga tribal community youths after accusing them of slaughtering a cow

title: Policemen
the_lynching: Rumours of cow slaughter triggered violence with protesters targeting police vehicles and setting afire shops, leaving seven policemen injured. The post-mortem report found that the cow had died due to an ailment

title: Praveen Poojary (28) and others
victim_action: Were getting ready to transport four calves
the_lynching: The victim was getting ready to transport four calves in a minivan to neighbouring Shimoga district as part of a contract with a cattle dealer. Nearly 30 people, led by local HJV leader Arvind Sherigar, surrounded the minivan and attacked Poojary and Devadiga with iron rods.

title: Manish Mandal (30)
victim_action: Honked to clear the road of cows
accused_action: gathered fellow villagers and beat up the victim
the_lynching: Suffered serious injury on his left eye after he was beaten up for scaring a group of cattle by honking in a bid to move them off the middle of the road

title: Abhishek Gaur and others
victim_action: Tried to stop a vehicle transporting cows
the_lynching: Two volunteers of a Gau Raksha Dal were injured Saturday morning after they were shot at, allegedly by persons illegally transporting beef,

title: Abdul Rashid
victim_action: Was headed to address a rally
the_lynching: Minor injuries in an attack on his vehicle by some Vishwa Hindu Parishad (VHP) activists

title: Unknown
victim_action: were transporting cattle
the_lynching: A case of rioting was registered after trucks carrying cattle, allegedly for slaughter, were intercepted by residents of Chilla village.

title: Sajid
victim_action: were transporting meat
accused_action: pelted stones on the truck and beat up the driver
the_lynching: Several people, including policemen, were injured in a clash after local residents stopped a truck suspecting it was carrying beef. The police had to resort to firing in the air to control the agitated crowd.Police said some local residents spotted three trucks carrying meat were crossing the Palwal-Aligarh road. While two of the trucks managed to pass the area, the third was stopped.

title: Mohammad Ayub
victim_action: were transporting an ox and a calf
accused_action: bludgeoned the victims to death with baseball bats
the_lynching: After the accident the accused got out of their cars and thrashed Ayub with “baseball stick and iron pipe, and injured him that led to his death

title: Unknown
victim_tag: Tamil Nadu animal husbandry department officials
victim_action: Were transporting cattle for breeding
accused_names: Chainaram, Kamlesh, Vikram, Jaswant and 50 others
accused_action: Pelted stones on the trucks and tried setting them ablaze
the_lynching: Around 50 cow vigilantes on Sunday attacked a truck from Tamil Nadu ferrying cows on suspicions of cattle smuggling. The accused tried to beat the officials. They also tried to set the truck on fire but police reached the spot and prevented them. Actions were also taken against seven policemen who did not take the matter seriously and reached late at the scene

title: Tarik Waseem and others
victim_action: were raiding a house based on information of cattle slaughter
the_lynching: Two Cops were injured after a group of people allegedly resorted to stone-pelting when a police team raided their house on information of cow slaughter

title: Sheikh Bismillah Sheikh Mobin and others
victim_action: were transporting beef
victim_names: Sheikh Bismillah Sheikh Mobin, Sheikh Siddique Sheikh Musa
accused_names: Akshay Garje, Nagesh Bali, Vikki Ahir, Vinod Ahir, Ganesh Dandge, Akshay Gaikwad, Gopal Ingle
the_lynching: Police arrested nine persons, including two alleged beef traders. Asked if the traders were really dealing in beef, Patil said, “We have collected the samples and have sent them to government forensic laboratory in Nagpur for tests.

title: Unknown
victim_action: were going to dispose of animal entrails and hide after Bakra Eid
the_lynching: Three persons, including a minor, were allegedly thrashed by a group of men when they were going to dispose of animal entrails and hide after Bakra Eid in Kanjhawla area.

title: Kaushik Purkait (24)
victim_action: was mistook to be part of a gang involved in smuggling of cattle. A buffalo meant for sacrifice had gone missing and on seeing Kaushik, a new face in the area, locals assumed he was one of the miscreants responsible for it.
accused_action: dragged him to a local club where he was severely beaten up.

title: Shadab
victim_action: was driving a truck carrying cows, allegedly trafficking them illegally. They took a detour to avoid a nearby police check point and the truck overturned killing 11 cows.
accused_action: wanted the police to hand over Shadab to them and hence got in a confrontation with them.

title: Bandhna Oraon and others
victim_action: intervened to save two people accused of practicing witchcraft.
accused_action: attacked a team of policemen and damaged their vehicles.
the_lynching: There were four deaths in the village within a month. The villagers had a meeting and in which it was discussed the possibility of a local’s involvement in witchcraft. The villagers went to Bijupara in Ranchi district the next day and consulted an oracle, who gave them descriptions that matched with the victims. The oracle claimed that the two were involved in witchcraft which led to the deaths. Before the villagers could kill the Oraons, Parshuram got a whiff and slipped out of the village and approached the police.

title: Tribal woman and others
victim_action: seen the woman doing “black magic”.
accused_action: started pelting stones at her house and eventually ransacked it.
the_lynching: Villagers have now had ostracised her from the community and her family is not even allowed to draw water from the common pond.

title: Sikh men
victim_action: approached a woman and she started feeling drowsy. Also, they allegedly extorted money in the name of gurdwara.
accused_action: accused them of witchcraft and assaulted them.

the_lynching: They barged into the elderly couple's home and hit them with blunt objects.

the_lynching: So they beat them to death and burnt their bodies.

the_lynching: The villagers beat Savna to death.

accused_action: got angry over the police action and pelted stones on police jeep. They also rescued the youth from police captivity
the_lynching: The police, in retaliation, fired three rounds on the mob, hitting the legs of two.

title: Vinod Kumar
victim_action: Unknown
accused_names: Bhagiwander sarpanch Charnjeet Kaur and her son Amarinder Singh Raju, Mandeep Kaur Brar,  and 10 others
the_lynching: The accused took away Vinod in a trolley and dumped him in Bhagiwander village common point after inflicting sharp-edged weapon injuries.

title: Unknown
victim_action: Were found together at girl's residence.
accused_names: Sugriv, Sunil, Sushil, Nek Singh and Rinki (FIR lodged by the boy’s father)
accused_action: beat a boy to death and poisoned a girl.
the_lynching: A boy was allegedly beaten to death and a girl was poisoned after her brothers found the two together at their residence. The girl is in criticial condition in district hospital.

title: Samarendra Samanta
victim_action: Stopped and beat a railway hawker from selling near Malda town station.
accused_action: raid RPF camp office at the Malda station and beat a RPF constable.
the_lynching: After a RPF constable beat a railway hawker, a mob of around 300-400 hawkers surrounded the RPF camp office at the station. They catch hold of the constable and beat him to death.
which_law: For last four months under the Swachch Bharat initiative, no hawkers are being allowed to sell their products at the Malda Town station.

title: Unknown
victim_action: Suspected of possessing beef.
accused_action: assaulted and abused two meat traders.
the_lynching: On suspicion of possessing beef, a group of cow vigilanties assaulted and abused two meat traders. One of the assailants was seen slapping the victim and demanding him to say “jai Sri Ram”.

title: Mangesh Shantaram Patil
victim_action: Lodged a police complaint against the accused's misbehaviour during a panchayat meeting.
accused_action: beat the victim with iron rods.
the_lynching: A group of eight villagers allegedly attacked the Sarpanch with iron rods leading to his death.
which_law: This is a case of murder.

title: Rajender Bhatia (55)
victim_action: Had parked his car outside his groud-floor flat which allegedly blocked the way to the second floor.
accused_names: Kartik, Ashok Oberoi, Mohit Oberoi and Sonu
the_lynching: Kartik along with associates allegedly barge into Bhatia’s flat and scold him for not giving him a duplicate key to the terrace. They get into a fight over car parking. Kartik and associates beat Bhatia to death.
which_law: Section 304 (culpable homicide not amounting to murder)

title: Munne Bharti and family
victim_action: Was travelling to Delhi.
accused_action: surrounded a car and threathened to set the car on fire if people in the car don't chant "Jai Shri Ram".
the_lynching: After noticing long beard and muslim veil, 4-5 Bajrang Dal activists surround a car and threathen to set it on fire if people (Muslims) in the car don't chant "Jai Shri Ram".

title: Ravinder Kumar (31)
victim_action: Had asked two people not to urinate in public.
accused_action: a group of about 20 people used bricks wrapped in a towel as a weapon to kill the e-rickshaw driver.
the_lynching: Ravinder Kumar was beaten to death about seven hours after he asked two people not to urinate in public.
which_law: This is a case of murder.

title: Mohammad Ayub Pandit
victim_action: Was on duty outside the Jama Masjid mosque.
the_lynching: A DSP was on duty outside the mosque on 'Shab-e-qadr' when the mob attacked him. DSP opened fire, injuring 3 persons. The mob then went on a rampage, targeting empty security pickets in the area. DSP was stripped naked and stoned to death.

title: Zafar Khan
victim_action: Tried to stop Municipality employees from scaring women defecating in the open and taking their photographs.
the_lynching: Municipality employees beat a middle-aged man to death when he allegedly tries to stop them from scaring women defecating in the open and taking their photographs.

title: Unknown
victim_action: Related to a boy (Muslim boy who allgedly 'eve-teased' a Hindu girl)
the_lynching: A Muslim boy allegedly 'eve-teased' a Hindu girl. The girl's family reportedly attacked the boy's house.

title: Ashok Kumar (40), Ajay Mishra
victim_action: was involved in a dispute over the pradhan election.
accused_tag: members of the opposition in the area
accused_names: Updesh, Nirvesh, Sandesh, Harikesh — and three other unidentified youths
the_lynching: Village pradhan was shot dead by some men outside his house. Residents caught one of the assailants and lynched him to death. Police suspect the murder was a fallout of dispute over the pradhan election.

title: Rafeeq and Habib
victim_action: were found skinning a cow.
accused_action: torching police jeeps and attacking forces.
the_lynching: Rumors of cow slaughter led to violence with a mob of villagers torching police jeeps and attacking forces in Karhal area.

title: Prabha Mohan Rangpise (40)
victim_action: had a quarrel over a cat entering her neighbour’s house.
accused_names: Amol Sandipan Balgude (25), Ganesh, alias Bhaiya Shrimant Patil (24), Akash Rajesh Monde (22), Raju Nandakishor Salve (23)
the_lynching: The victim's cat entered the house of their neighbour Raju Salve. But Salve allegedly threw it outside his house. The victim went to question Raju about this and got into a fight. Raju accompanied with his friends beat the victim to death.
which_law: sections 302, 324, 323, 34 of the Indian Penal Code

title: Guru Prasad Mishra (58)
victim_action: used to move RTI applications on development works done by village head.
the_lynching: According to a complaint, Triloki along with his brothers and sons attacked the RTI activist's house and brutally assaulted him. The RTI Activist, Mishra, died while being taken to the hospital.

title: Ashok Kispotta
victim_action: was involved in a land dispute.
accused_names: Ratiram Raut (50), Sadhuram (50), Asharam (54), Subhash (59), Mahesh Ram (59), Abhiram (20), Ramniwas (32), Anil (25), Vinod (23), Pushpa (32), Gulapi(40), Sukhi (48) and Basanti Bai (40)
the_lynching: Members of Raut family attacked the farmer over an old land dispute. Farmer died on the spot.
which_law: section 302 (murder) of Indian Penal Code; sections 148 (rioting), 149, and 323 (voluntarily causing hurt) of the IPC

title: Anil Pandey (30)
victim_tag: member of the Kumar Pillai gang
victim_action: his pet dog disturbed a cricket match in the area.
the_lynching: The incident took place a day after the victim's pet dog disturbed a cricket match in the area and snarled at these men.

title: Afsar Ali and Pairu (early 20s)
victim_action: were allegedly found carrying the hide of an ox.
the_lynching: The victims were found carrying the hide of an ox. Shiv Sena activists have been running a campaign across the state to ban the functioning of any meat shop or slaughter house during Navratri.
which_law: Uttar Pradesh Prevention of Cow Slaughter Act

title: Naim (35), Sheikh Sajju (25), Sheikh Siraj (26) and Sheikh Halim (28)
victim_action: suspected of being child lifters.
victim_names: Naim (35), Sheikh Sajju (25), Sheikh Siraj (26) and Sheikh Halim (28)
the_lynching: Mob lynched 4 men following rumours of child-lifters being present in the area.

title: Jainuddin
victim_action: allegedly kidnapping and raping a 10-year-old girl.
the_lynching: Angry over the alleged kidnapping and rape of a minor Dalit girl, a mob attacked the house where the accused was hiding and thrashed him.

title: Nabil Mohammed
victim_action: got involved in a fight.
accused_names: Mohd Awaiz alias Owais Patel and six others
the_lynching: During a “friendly” fight, Owais attacked and punched Nabil on his body and particularly on his head, following which Nabil collapsed and died.

title: Nagaram (60)
the_lynching: Beat the family to death.

title: Sunil (15)
victim_action: allegedly barged into a house
the_lynching: beaten to death by locals.

title: P Savahir (27)
victim_action: Was seen going to a woman's house
accused_action: mob questioned the victim and brutally attacked him.
the_lynching: mob questioned the victim and brutally attacked him.

title: Praveen Kumar (30)
victim_action: objected to electicity pole being installed outside his house
accused_names: Vijay, Sooraj, Sudhir, Sunil, Shimla, Kanchan and Sonam
accused_action: the accused dragged the two men into their home and beat them to death with rods and sticks.
the_lynching: the accused dragged the two men into their home and beat them to death with rods and sticks.

title: Suresh Gautam (35)
victim_action: Was helping a local exorcist
accused_action: beat up and stabbed the accused.
the_lynching: villagers started beating up Suresh when one of them, identified as Dheeraj, stabbed him with a knife. Suresh was rushed to a nearby hospital but died due to excessive bleeding.

title: Kalicharan Nishad (40)
victim_action: Had gone to his daughter's school to request reducing pending fees
accused_action: beat up elder daughter who was present there and latter assaulted the 40-year-old leading to his death.
the_lynching: beat up elder daughter who was present there and latter assaulted the 40-year-old leading to his death.

title: Atul (28)
victim_action: Tried kidnapping a minor
the_lynching: the victim was severely beaten up by the villagers and died by the time police reached the spot.

title: Nihal Sayyed (22)
victim_action: victim's car brushed a two-wheeler
the_lynching: pulled him out of his vehicle, beat him up and fled after he lay unconscious and bleeding from the neck.

title: Shahnawaz (38)
victim_action: two-wheeler grazed a car
the_lynching: beat up the victim with iron rods for 15 minutes.
